result.description:
This flow will wait for a tracker to complete its progress on the provided instance and return the results of the tracker.

Inputs:

  • Progress Id - Sys Id of the sys_execution_tracker record.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the test suite .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Interval - The time that the 'Action' in this flow periodically checks the progress of the tracker. You can add the interval either in days or hours or minutes or seconds. Default to 30 seconds.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Percent Complete - The percentage of the operation completed.
  • Stash ID - The sys_id of the sys_repo_stash record. Can be used to uniquely identify a stash from the sys_repo_stash records.
  • Stash URL - The URL of REST endpoint to apply the stashed changes from sys_id of the sys_repo_stash record.
  • Result ID - Unique identifier of the results information. Use this value when calling the associated results endpoint.
  • Result URL - The URL of REST endpoint to obtain the results of the endpoint execution, such as results.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid Progress ID
  • Unable to get the execution progress for the Progress Id

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given a Stash Id (sys_id) of a record in sys_repo_stash table, this Sub Flow will apply the stashed changes to the respective application.

Inputs:

  • Stash Id - Sys Id of the sys_repo_stash record.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance in which you apply the stashed changes.
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response.
  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled".
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

To use this sub flow, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
Given a password reset request and status value, it updates the password reset request status.

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.
  • Status - Status of the request having two choices Completed With Success or Completed With Failure.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if it succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
result.annotation: It updates the password reset request status.

result.description:
Request Multi-Level Approval, for use with Playbook experience. Creates a multi level approval record for assigned to Manager and Manager's Manager

Inputs:

  • Assigned To - User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Comments - Comments for approval record
  • Due Date - Due date for approval record
  • Table - Table to query
  • Record - Record Associated for Approval

    • Outputs:

    • Approval State - State can be approved or rejected.
    • Query for List filter - Query for list filter.

result.description:
Given an ATF test suite's id, this flow will start an ATF Test Suite on the provided instance and give the suite execution results. Since running ATF suites is an on-demand request, a Scheduled client test runner is required for running ATF test suites.

Inputs:

  • Test Suite Sys Id - Sys Id of the ATF test suite.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the test suite.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Browser Name - Browser name where you wish to run the scheduled client test runner. The browser names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Chrome", "Firefox", "Edge", "IE", "Safari". Default to "Any"
  • Browser Version - 'Browser version starts with' of the 'Browser' where the client test runner is running. Default to "Any".
  • OS Name - Operating System name where you wish to open the browser. The operating system names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Windows", "Mac OS X", "Linux'. Default to "Any".
  • OS Version - 'Operating System version starts with' of the 'Operating System' you wish to use to open the scheduled client test runner. Default to "Any".
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Result URL - The URL of the ATF suite execution record. You can navigate to this URL and check verify results.
  • Test Suite Duration - Total time taken to run the tests (in seconds).
  • Rolledup Test Success Count - Number of tests that are successful. This includes all the child tests that ran successfully.
  • Rolledup Test Failure Count - Number of tests that are failed. This includes all the failed child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Error Count - Number of tests that are errored. This includes all the errored child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Skip Count - Number of tests that are skipped. This includes all the skipped child tests.
  • Test Suite Name - Name of the test suite.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid ATF Suite ID
  • ATF Schedule Run - record insert failed
  • Start ATF Suite Failed with the given Suite ID
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Start ATF Suite With ID or Name feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Show Knowledge article to agent for process activity; optionally waits for user to complete flow data record.

Inputs:

  • Title - Title that will be displayed in Playbook experience
  • Knowledge Article - Selected Knowledge article to show in Playbook experience
  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Automated - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

result.description:
Calls appropriate subflow by using configuration variables of the provider.

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.
  • New Password - Password for the user being reset.
  • Current Password - The current password of the user.
  • Action Current action choices i.e. Reset Password, Change Password, Unlock Account, Get Lock State.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to 'Success' if the request succeeds or 'Error' if a failure occurs or 'Pending' in case of Async request
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Is Flow - 'True' if the password reset process is configured to execute via Integration Hub flows. 'False' if the password reset process is configured to execute via workflows.
  • Context ID - Context Id of the workflow. Populated only when the password reset process is configured to execute via workflows

Error Messages:

Error messages for this action is populated from the corresponding subflow executed.

result.description:
Given the sys_id of a result object, this sub-flow will return the installation status of each package along with entire batch plan

Inputs:

  • Result ID -ID of result object corresponding to batch install operation. This ID is returned in output field "Result ID" from "Batch Install" sub flow and action
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Batch Plan - Result of batch plan as JSON object
  • Batch Items - JSON array where each object represents the result of installation of single package in the batch

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
Simple instruction process activity for Playbook Workspace Experience, that optionally waits for user to complete the flow data record.

Inputs:

  • Message - Message that will be displayed to the end user using Playbook Workspace Experience
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.

result.description:
Create a Flow Data record with specified data definition.

Inputs:

  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • User form for data collection - Data Definition of inputs.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
This flow will commit a retrieved update set with a given sys_id onto the provided instance. The retrieved update set contents are based on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where the retrieved update set comes from and where it should be committed.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Retrieved Update Set Id - Sys Id of the retrieved update set to be committed that exists on the provided instance.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Update Set Id - The sys_id of the sys_update_set record that was created after a successful commit.
  • Update Set URL - The URL to the form of the created update set.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Create Record process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record. This flow may be used within an activity definition to update a specified record and fields.

Inputs:

  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Table - Default table specified in Flow Data table input
  • Fields - Default fields specified in Flow Data fields input
  • Fields to show after creation - Playbook record fields to render within Agent Workspace, after the update is complete.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Table - Table specified by flow data.
  • Record - Record created by flow..
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Show list of records, for use with Agent Workspace Playbook experience. Process activity optionally waits before proceeding with process execution.

Inputs:

  • Table - Table to query
  • Conditions - Conditions to query for
  • Fields to show - Columns to show in list results
  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.
  • List Title - Title to show above the list of records

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Fields - Comma delimited list of columns specified in Fields to show input.
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Given an application sys_id and version, this subflow will rollback the application on the provided instance

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application you wish to rollback. To rollback customization for store application, provide Sys Id for the store application
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance on which the application will be rolled back
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The expected version of the rolled back application or customization to store application
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter sys_id
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
Start Full Instance Scan on the provided instance. This will internally make a call to a REST API and returns the Instance Scan progress result.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the Instance Scan .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.
  • Result Id - The sys_id of the result record generated from the scan
  • Result URL - The URL to the result api for a reference
  • Finding URL - The URL of the Finding table where all the findings can be found from the scan
  • Finding Label - Information to customer that 10,000 records are shown

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • The scan exceeded the time allowed
  • Multiple Full Scans cannot run at the same time
  • The scan completed. However, one or more individual checks failed.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
This flow will apply remote changes from source control on an application with a given sys_id on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application on which you wish to apply changes from source control. To apply changes for customization for store application, provide Sys Id for the store application.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where app needs to be updated.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Branch Name - Branch Name of the source control repo from which changes will be applied to application.
  • Auto Upgrade Base Application - This field will only be used when changes are applied for customization to store application. Should be set to false if base store app should not be upgraded if the latest Git commit to apply is built on newer version of base app than what is installed on the instance. Else leave it empty as default is true.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Stash ID - The sys_id of the sys_repo_stash record. Can be used to uniquely identify a stash from the sys_repo_stash records.
  • Stash URL - The URL of REST endpoint to apply the stashed changes from sys_id of the sys_repo_stash record.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Start Combo Suite Scan on the provided instance. This will internally make a call to a REST API and returns the Instance Scan progress result.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the Instance Scan .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Combo Sys Id - The Sys Id of source-target combo record in scan_combo table .
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.
  • Result Id - The sys_id of the result record generated from the scan
  • Result URL - The URL to the result api for a reference
  • Finding URL - The URL of the Finding table where all the findings can be found from the scan
  • Finding Label - Information to customer that 10,000 records are shown

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • The scan exceeded the time allowed
  • Multiple Full Scans cannot run at the same time
  • The scan completed. However, one or more individual checks failed.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given an application scope, this subflow will install the application on the given instance

Inputs:

  • Scope - Scope name of the application you wish to install. To install customization for store application, provide scope name for the store application
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance where you wish to install the application
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the your company application or customization to store application you wish to install
  • Auto Upgrade Base Application - This field will only be used when customization to store application is installed. Should be set to true if base app should be upgraded along with installation of customization to store app. Else leave it empty as default is false. This field will be ignored if “Base App Version” is provided
  • Base App Version - The version of store application you wish to install
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled"
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Rollback Version - Previous version of the application installed. Can be rolled back too.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter scope
  • Application version is currently installed
  • Invalid application downgrade
  • Unable to locate application
  • Latest version is currently installed

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
Start Suite Scan for the scoped apps on the provided instance. This will internally make a call to a REST API and returns the Instance Scan progress result.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the Instance Scan .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Suite Sys Id - The Sys Id of the suite.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Body:

  • List of Scoped App Sys Id - List of scoped app sys ids

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.
  • Result Id - The sys_id of the result record generated from the scan
  • Result URL - The URL to the result api for a reference
  • Finding URL - The URL of the Finding table where all the findings can be found from the scan
  • Finding Label - Information to customer that 10,000 records are shown

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • The scan exceeded the time allowed
  • Multiple Full Scans cannot run at the same time
  • The scan completed. However, one or more individual checks failed.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
This flow will allow a target instance to retrieve an update set from a source instance.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the target Instance that is retrieving the update set.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Instance Id - Instance id of the source instance found from the associated sys_update_set_source record on the target instance.
  • Update Set Id - Sys Id of the sys_update_set record from the source instance.
  • Auto Preview - When true, this optional parameter allows the update set to be previewed upon retrieval. When not present, the "glide.update_set.auto_preview" property is used as a substitute.
  • Clean Up Retrieved - When true, this optional parameter allows for the target instance to retrieve the update set even if it has been previously retrieved. Upon retrieval, the previously retrieved update set gets overwritten. When not present, this parameter is set to false.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Retrieved Update Set Id - The sys_id of the sys_remote_update_set record that was created after a successful retrieval.
  • Has Preview Problem - Indicates a preview problem if Auto Preview was enabled. Can be empty.
  • Preview Problem Count - The number of preview problems if Auto Preview was enabled. Can be empty.
  • Preview Problem URL - The URL to view preview problems if Auto Preview was enabled. Can be empty.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Resets the password. Provides a temporary password and prompts user to change the password. Ensures that new password conforms to the password format and history policies.

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.
  • Password - Password for the user being reset.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if the request succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid User Record
  • Invalid Request
  • The request has no process associated with it.
  • The user associated with request is not valid.
  • The process associated with request is not valid.
  • There are more than one credential stores defined for process.
  • The credential store associated with request is not valid.
  • non_fatal_failure (In case of password policy failure including history policy)
result.annotation: Reset a local ServiceNow user password

result.description:
Creates a webhook subscription for the specified team's channel.

Inputs :

  • Webhook Registry Record Name - Name of the record in 'Webhook Registry' where Callback URL and Client State are stored.
    • Change Type - Type of change in the subscribed resource that will raise a change notification. Supported values are: created, updated, deleted. Multiple values can be combined using a comma.
  • Team ID - Unique ID of the team.
  • Channel ID - Unique ID of the channel.

Outputs :

  • Subscription - Object containing these details of the subscription: -
    • ID - Unique ID of the subscription.
    • Resource - Specifies the resource that will be monitored for changes.
    • Creator ID - Unique ID of the user or service principal that created the subscription.
    • Change Type - Type of change in the subscribed resource that will raise a change notification.
    • Notification URL - URL of the endpoint that receives change notifications.
    • Expiration Date Time - Date and time in UTC when the webhook subscription expires.
    .
  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to “Success”. If there is a failure in Microsoft Teams Graph, Status is set to “Error”.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages :

  • Unauthorized.
  • Access token is empty. Check Oauth Token and scope permission.
  • Invalid access token.
  • Invalid Webhook Registry Record Name.
  • Access denied to the specified resource.
  • Expiration date time should be greater than current time.
  • Expiration date time can only be 60 minutes in the future.
  • Invalid Change Type.
  • Invalid Notification URL scheme.
  • Invalid Notification URL.
  • Subscription validation request failed.
  • Invalid Resource.
  • Subscription for specified resource is not supported in specified API version.
  • Subscription limit reached for the specified resource.

To use this subflow, the corresponding Microsoft Teams Graph connection and credential must be created and associated with the Microsoft Teams Graph Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

result.description:
Calls appropriate subflow by using password expiration configuration of the given process.

Inputs:

  • User - User Record.
  • Password Reset Process - Password reset process record.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to 'Success' if the request succeeds or 'Error' if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

Error messages for this action is populated from the corresponding subflow executed.

result.description:
Create Record process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record. This flow may be used within an activity definition to update a specified record and fields.

Inputs:

  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Table - Default table specified in Flow Data table input
  • Fields - Default fields specified in Flow Data fields input
  • Fields to show after creation - Playbook record fields to render within Agent Workspace, after the update is complete.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Table - Table specified by flow data.
  • Record - Record created by flow..
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Guided Setup Activate Plugin subflow for Playbook Workspace Experience, this waits for user to complete the plugin installation process.

Inputs:

  • Plugin Query - Encoded query of plugin's
    From v_plugin table filter list of plugin's need to be installed and use that encoded query in PAD builder.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.

result.description:
Given an application sys_id, this subflow will install the application on the given instance

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application you wish to install. To install customization for store application, provide Sys Id for the store application
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance where you wish to install the application
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the application you wish to install or customization to store application you wish to install
  • Auto Upgrade Base Application - This field will only be used when customization to store application is installed. Should be set to true if base app should be upgraded along with installation of customization to store app. Else leave it empty as default is false. This field will be ignored if “Base App Version” is provided
  • Base App Version - The version of store application you wish to install.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled"
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Rollback Version - Previous version of the application installed. Can be rolled back too.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter sys_id
  • Application version is currently installed
  • Invalid application downgrade
  • Unable to locate application
  • Latest version is currently installed

result.description:
Start Suite Scan for the update sets on the provided instance. This will internally make a call to a REST API and returns the Instance Scan progress result.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the Instance Scan .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Suite Sys Id - The Sys Id of the suite.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Body:

  • List of Scoped App Sys Id - List of update set sys ids

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.
  • Result Id - The sys_id of the result record generated from the scan
  • Result URL - The URL to the result api for a reference
  • Finding URL - The URL of the Finding table where all the findings can be found from the scan
  • Finding Label - Information to customer that 10,000 records are shown

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • The scan exceeded the time allowed
  • Multiple Full Scans cannot run at the same time
  • The scan completed. However, one or more individual checks failed.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Changes the password of an authenticated and unlocked user account to the provided new password. Verifies the new password conforms to the password format and history policies. Produces an error if the user is not authenticated or is locked out. Use “Reset Password” to unlock a locked user account and require a password change.

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.
  • Current Password - The current password of the user.
  • New Password - The new password the user wants to set.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if the request succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid User Record
  • User is locked
  • Invalid Request
  • The request has no process associated with it.
  • The user associated with request is not valid.
  • The process associated with request is not valid.
  • There are more than one credential stores defined for process.
  • The credential store associated with request is not valid.
  • The current password is incorrect
  • You used that password recently. Choose a different password

result.description:
Given a rollback ID, this Sub Flow will roll back the installation(s) of package(s) installed as a single batch

Inputs:

  • Rollback ID -ID of the rollback context corresponding to the batch install plan. This ID is returned in output field "Rollback ID" from "Batch Install" sub flow and action
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance where you wish to install the applications
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

To use this sub flow, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

Apply remote changes from source control using application scope on the given instance.

Inputs:

  • App Scope - Scope of the application on which you wish to apply changes from source control. To apply changes for customization for store application, provide scope for the store application.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where app needs to be updated.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Branch Name - Branch Name of the Git repo from which changes will be applied to application.
  • Auto Upgrade Base App - This field will only be used when changes are applied for customization to store application. Should be set to false if base store app should not be upgraded if the latest Git commit to apply is built on newer version of base app than what is installed on the instance. Else leave it empty as default is true.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Stash ID - The sys_id of the sys_repo_stash record. Can be used to uniquely identify a stash from the sys_repo_stash records.
  • Stash URL - The URL of REST endpoint to apply the stashed changes from sys_id of the sys_repo_stash record.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given an application sys_id, this subflow will publish the application to the app-repo

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application you wish to publish. To publish customization for store application, provide Sys Id for the store application
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance from which you wish to publish the application to app-repo
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the application or customization to store application you wish to publish
  • Dev Notes - The notes that app author wants to publish for this version update
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter sys_id
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
Request Ad hoc Approval, for use with Playbook experience. Creates Ad hoc approval records for Users or Group members.

Inputs:

  • Approver - List of Approver for approval record.
  • Approver Group - User group for approval record.
  • Table - Table to query
  • Record - Record Associated for Approval

    • Outputs:

    • Approval Record - Approval Records.
    • Approval State - Approval Record state.
    • Flow Data Created Date - Date format generated for list filter query

result.description:
Import Application from Source Control using Repository URL on the given instance.

Inputs:

  • Repo URL - The URL (HTTPS or SSH) to the Git repository where the application files reside.
  • Branch Name - Branch name on the Git repository to import.
  • Credential Sys ID - The sys_id of the basic authentication or SSH credential with access to remote git repository. If left empty, API will use the credential sys_id set in the "glide.source_control. default_basic_auth_credential_sys_id" or "glide.source_control. default_ssh_private_key_credential_sys_id" property.
  • MID Server Sys ID - The sys_id of the MID server (ecc_agent) used for the connection.
  • Auto Upgrade Base Application - This field will only be used when importing a customization to a store application. Set to false if base store app should not upgrade when the application is built on newer version of base app compared to what is installed on the instance. Else leave as default, true.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance on which app needs to be imported.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response.
  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

To use this subflow, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given a Plugin Id, this flow will Rollback a plugin to the last installed version on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Plugin Id - ID of the Plugin you wish to rollback.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to rollback the plugin.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter Plugin Id
  • Plugin Id is not valid
  • Plugin is not Active on the instance, unable to rollback
  • Rollback Context for plugin not found, verify that plugin is activated on instance.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Create Record process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record. This flow may be used within an activity definition to update a specified record and fields.

Inputs:

  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Table - Default table specified in Flow Data table input
  • Fields - Default fields specified in Flow Data fields input
  • Fields to show after creation - Playbook record fields to render within Agent Workspace, after the update is complete.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Table - Table specified by flow data.
  • Record - Record created by flow..
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Get a local ServiceNow user accounts lock status

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if the request succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Locked - True if the user is locked. False if the user is not locked. Populated only if Status is Success.

Error Messages:

  • User Inactive
  • Invalid User Record
  • Invalid Request
  • The request has no process associated with it.
  • The user associated with request is not valid.
  • The process associated with request is not valid.
  • There are more than one credential stores defined for process.
  • The credential store associated with request is not valid.

result.description:
Manual process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record.

Inputs:

  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
This flow will commit multiple retrieved update sets. The order in which update sets are specified is respected during the commit process. The operation may exit early if the order cannot be preserved.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where the retrieved update sets come from and where they should be committed.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Retrieved Update Set IDs - Sys Ids of the retrieved update sets to be committed that exist on the provided instance.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on the result of the operation if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Commit Items - A JSON array of objects (object structure below) listing commit information for the retrieved update sets specified. Only relevant items are returned in a preflight validation failure scenario.
    • remote_update_set_id - Sys Id of one of the specified retrieved update sets to be committed representing this commit item.
    • local_update_set_id - The sys_id of the sys_update_set record that was created for this commit if applicable.
    • status - Status of the retrieved update set. Will be one of "not_processed", "failed", "errored", "successful", "skipped"
    • status_message - More information on the result of the operation if available. Can be empty.
    • tracker_id - Sys Id of the execution tracker used to track the progress of this commit.
    • url - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this commit.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
External link process activity for Playbook Workspace Experience, that optionally waits for user to complete the flow data record.

Inputs:

  • External Links - [ { "title": "link title", "type": "document/video", "url": "link url" } ]
    This will be displayed to the end user using Playbook Workspace Experience.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Update Record process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record. This flow may be used within an activity definition to update a specified record and fields.

Inputs:

  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Table - Default table specified in Flow Data table input
  • Record - Default record specified in Flow Data record input
  • Fields - Default fields specified in Flow Data fields input
  • Fields to show after update - Playbook record fields to render within Agent Workspace, after the update is complete.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Table - Table specified by flow data.
  • Record - Record updated by flow..
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
This flow will allow a target instance to retrieve an update set from a source instance.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the target Instance that is retrieving the update set.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Update Set Source Id - Sys Id of the sys_update_set_source record from the target instance which is used to identify the source instance.
  • Update Set Id - Sys Id of the sys_update_set record from the source instance.
  • Auto Preview - When true, this optional parameter allows the update set to be previewed upon retrieval. When not present, the "glide.update_set.auto_preview" property is used as a substitute.
  • Clean Up Retrieved - When true, this optional parameter allows for the target instance to retrieve the update set even if it has been previously retrieved. Upon retrieval, the previously retrieved update set gets overwritten. When not present, this parameter is set to false.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Retrieved Update Set Id - The sys_id of the sys_remote_update_set record that was created after a successful retrieval.
  • Has Preview Problem - Indicates a preview problem if Auto Preview was enabled. Can be empty.
  • Preview Problem Count - The number of preview problems if Auto Preview was enabled. Can be empty.
  • Preview Problem URL - The URL to view preview problems if Auto Preview was enabled. Can be empty.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given a list of ATF test suites’ IDs, this flow will start the ATF Test Suites on the provided instance and give the suites execution results. Since running ATF suites is an on-demand request, a Scheduled client test runner or cloud runner is required for running ATF test suites.

Inputs:

  • Run In Cloud - Run ATF tests suites in cloud runner.
  • Performance Run - Run performance profiling on ATF test suites.
  • Test Suites Sys IDs - Sys Ids of the ATF test suites.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the test suite.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Browser Name - Browser name where you wish to run the scheduled client test runner. The browser names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Chrome", "Firefox", "Edge", "IE", "Safari". Default to "Any"
  • Browser Version - 'Browser version starts with' of the 'Browser' where the client test runner is running. Default to "Any".
  • OS Name - Operating System name where you wish to open the browser. The operating system names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Windows", "Mac OS X", "Linux'. Default to "Any".
  • OS Version - 'Operating System version starts with' of the 'Operating System' you wish to use to open the scheduled client test runner. Default to "Any".
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Status Label - Will be set to "Pending”, “Running”,” Successful”, ”Failed” or "Cancelled”.
  • Rolledup Test Success Count - Number of tests that are successful. This includes all the child tests that ran successfully.
  • Rolledup Test Failure Count - Number of tests that are failed. This includes all the failed child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Error Count - Number of tests that are errored. This includes all the errored child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Skip Count - Number of tests that are skipped. This includes all the skipped child tests.
  • Test Result - Test result in JSON format for the input test suites.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid ATF Suite ID
  • ATF Schedule Run - record insert failed
  • Start ATF Suite Failed with the given Suite ID
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Start ATF Suite With ID or Name feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given a Plugin Id, this flow activates a plugin on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Plugin Id - ID of the plugin you wish to activate.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to activate the plugin.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter Plugin Id
  • Plugin Id is not valid
  • Invalid License for Plugin. Unable to activate
  • [WARNING] Plugin being activated requires a license, will not allow activation in production
  • [WARNING] The plugin is already active, repair plugin to upgrade or fix.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given an application scope, this subflow will publish the application to the app-repo

Inputs:

  • Scope - Scope name of the application you wish to publish. To publish customization for store application, provide scope name for the store application
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance from which you wish to publish the application to app-repo
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the application or customization to store application you wish to publish
  • Dev Notes - The notes that app author wants to publish for this version update
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter scope
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
Given a Batch Plan in JSON format, this Sub Flow will install multiple packages (applications, customizations to store application, and plugins) together in one single batch operation.

Inputs:

  • Batch Plan -JSON object which contains details of each package which needs to be installed in batch. Learn More about structure of this JSON object.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance where you wish to install the applications
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Result URL - Link to result object which contains batch install plan and the status of each installed item.
  • Result ID - ID of result object which contains batch install plan and the status of each installed item
  • Rollback ID - ID of the rollback context used to revert a batch install operation.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
This flow offers the ability to back out an update set on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where the update set comes from and where it should be backed out.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Update Set Id - Sys Id of the local update set to be backed out that exists on the provided instance.
  • Rollback Installs - When true, this parameter offers the ability to rollback the batch installation performed during the update set backout.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Back Out Problem Count - The number of back out problems.
  • Back Out Problem URL - The URL to the list of back out problems. Can be empty.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if the request succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid Request
  • Invalid user Record
  • The request has no process associated with it.
  • The user associated with request is not valid.
  • The process associated with request is not valid.
  • There are more than one credential stores defined for process.
  • The credential store associated with request is not valid.

result.description:
Manual process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record.

Inputs:

  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Automated - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Send Email process activity flow, to collect email inputs from user and send a standard ServiceNow outbound email.

Inputs:

  • To - To recipient list
  • Cc - Cc recipient list
  • Bcc - Bcc blind copy recipient list
  • Subject - Subject of email
  • Body - Body of message
  • Target Record - Record the email will be attached to
  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to populate details.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Given an ATF test suite's name, this flow will start an ATF Test Suite and give the suite execution results. Since running ATF suites is an on-demand request, a Scheduled client test runner is required for running ATF test suites.

Inputs:

  • Test Suite Name - Name of the ATF test suite.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the test suite.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Browser Name - Browser name where you wish to run the scheduled client test runner. The browser names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Chrome", "Firefox", "Edge", "IE", "Safari". Default to "Any"
  • Browser Version - 'Browser version starts with' of the 'Browser' where the client test runner is running. Default to "Any”.
  • OS Name - Operating System name where you wish to open the browser. The operating system names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Windows", "Mac OS X", "Linux'. Default to "Any".
  • OS Version - 'Operating System version starts with' of the 'Operating System' you wish to use to open the scheduled client test runner. Default to "Any".
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Result URL - The URL of the ATF suite execution record. You can navigate to this URL and check verify results.
  • Test Suite Duration - Total time taken to run the tests (in seconds).
  • Rolledup Test Success Count - Number of tests that are successful. This includes all the child tests that ran successfully.
  • Rolledup Test Failure Count - Number of tests that are failed. This includes all the failed child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Error Count - Number of tests that are errored. This includes all the errored child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Skip Count - Number of tests that are skipped. This includes all the skipped child tests.
  • Test Suite Name - Name of the test suite.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid ATF Suite ID
  • ATF Schedule Run - record insert failed
  • Start ATF Suite Failed with the given Suite ID
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Start ATF Suite With ID or Name feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Simple instruction process activity for Playbook Workspace Experience, that optionally waits for user to complete the flow data record.

Inputs:

  • Message - Message that will be displayed to the end user using Playbook Workspace Experience
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
This flow will set multiple update sets to be in completed state given the list of sys_ids onto the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Update Set IDs - List of Sys Id of the update sets to be completed that exist on the provided instance.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where the update sets are coming from and where they should be set to completed.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."

Outputs:

  • Status - Status will be one of the following: 2 (Successful) or 3 (Failed).
  • Result - An object where the key is the Sys id and the value is the corresponding action response
    • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
    • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
    • State - The state of the update set after execution
    • Name - The name of the update set being executed

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Send Email process activity flow, to collect email inputs from user and send a standard ServiceNow outbound email.

Inputs:

  • To - To recipient list
  • Cc - Cc recipient list
  • Bcc - Bcc blind copy recipient list
  • Subject - Subject of email
  • Body - Body of message
  • Target Record - Record the email will be attached to
  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to populate details.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Update Record process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record. This flow may be used within an activity definition to update a specified record and fields.

Inputs:

  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Table - Default table specified in Flow Data table input
  • Record - Default record specified in Flow Data record input
  • Fields - Default fields specified in Flow Data fields input
  • Fields to show after update - Playbook record fields to render within Agent Workspace, after the update is complete.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Table - Table specified by flow data.
  • Record - Record updated by flow..
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.
