result.description:
This flow will allow a target instance to retrieve and automatically preview multiple update sets from a source instance.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the target Instance that is retrieving the update set.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Instance Id - Instance id of the source instance found from the associated sys_update_set_source record on the target instance.
  • Update Set Ids - A list of sys Ids of the sys_update_set records from the source instance.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Has Preview Problem - Indicates there is a preview problem in at least one of the update sets.
  • Result - A JSON with the results of the retrieve and auto preview of each update set. It contains the key "results" with a list of result objects corresponding to each of the update sets.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Given an application scope and version, this subflow will rollback the application on the provided instance

Inputs:

  • Scope - Scope name of the application you wish to rollback. To rollback customization for store application, provide scope name for the store application
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance on which the application will be rolled back
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The expected version of the rolled back application or customization to store application
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter scope
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

result.description:
This flow will preview a retrieved update set on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where the retrieved update set comes from and where it should be previewed.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Retrieved Update Set ID - Sys Id of the retrieved update set to be previewed that exists on the provided instance.
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response.
  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Has Preview Problem - Indicates a preview problem
  • Preview Problem Count - The number of preview problems. Can be empty.
  • Preview Problem URL - The URL to view preview problems. Can be empty.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

result.description:
Manual process activity, that optionally waits for user to complete flow data record.

Inputs:

  • Title - Title that will be displayed in Playbook experience
  • Description - Description message that will be displayed in Playbook experience.
  • Tag Line - Header tag-line message for Playbook experience component.
  • Footer - Footer message for Playbook experience component.
  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to provide flow data inputs.
  • Wait for user input - When checked, does not wait for flow data to be in a completed state.

Outputs:

  • Record - Flow Data Record.
  • Automated - True/False based on whether the flow waited for user input or not.

result.description:
Given a change request, this flow executes a given CI action.

Inputs:

  • Change request - ID of the change request you wish to implement.
  • CI action - ID of the sn_cimaf_action record which needs to be executed
  • Action parameters - JSON containing required and optional parameters to execute CI action

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success", if the request is completed. Will be set to "Error", if the request failed due to an error.
  • Error message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid update on record
  • Missing required parameters
  • CI action execution failure

result.description:
User Form process activity, that waits for user to mark the activity complete by updating a flow data record. This flow may be used within an activity definition to display a user form for the given table, view and fields.

Inputs:

  • Table - Table for the user form
  • Record - Record displayed in the user form
  • Form View - UI view to use in the user form
  • Form Fields - Fields to display in the user form
  • Display Fields - Optional label and value fields to display above the user form.
  • Footer - Optional include a footer below the form.
  • Show Attachments - When selected, includes attachments in the user form.
  • Show SLA - When selected, shows an SLA timer for the record.
  • Show Checklist - When selected, shows a checklist for the record.
  • Assignment Group - (Optional) Group required to complete, skip or restart the activity.
  • Assigned To - (Optional) User required to complete, skip or restart the activity.

Outputs:

  • Table - Table for the user form
  • Record - Record update in the user form

result.description:
Given table name and the sys_id of the record in the table, start point Instance Scan on the provided instance. This will internally make a call to a REST API and returns the Instance Scan progress result.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the Instance Scan .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Table Name - Table Name of the target record
  • Sys Id - Target record's sys _id
  • API Version - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified. When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.
  • Result Id - The sys_id of the result record generated from the scan
  • Result URL - The URL to the result api for a reference
  • Finding URL - The URL of the Finding table where all the findings can be found from the scan
  • Finding Label - Information to customer that 10,000 records are shown

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid Table Name
  • The scan exceeded the time allowed
  • The scan completed. However, one or more individual checks failed.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More
